image.altText: A woman looks at her baby who she is holding aloft for the camera

props.synopsis: In what may be SA's hottest election contest, the ABC visits the marginal seat of Sturt to ask people what issues are most important to them.

title.children: The talk on the street in South Australia's most marginal seat

image.altText: an older woman with short blonde/grey hair in an apron standing in front of a commercial coffee machine

props.synopsis: At 64, Jan Lawlor is not your typical fast-food worker. While some women her age are in the workforce out of financial need, Jan is working for the love of it.

title.children: 'Nanny' works in youth-dominated fast food industry because she loves it

image.altText: photo taken through gap from inside building shows cars and the floor covered with pigeon excrement and feathers

props.synopsis: Locals in a South Australian town known for its silo art fear visitors are being driven away by the "toxic" smell created by hundreds of pigeons roosting in a derelict building.

title.children: Country town furious over 'pigeon palace' poo problem

image.altText: a cute dog

props.synopsis: The miniature dachshund who disappeared a year-and-a-half ago has been captured, wildlife rescuers say.

title.children: Valerie the dachshund 'fit and well' after 529 days on Kangaroo Island

image.altText: Craig McRae and Daniel McStay walking together on the MCG.

props.synopsis: Collingwood is sweating on Daniel McStay's scan results after he suffered a heavy knock to the knee in the win over Essendon, while Adelaide faces a nervous wait to determine the severity of Riley Thilthorpe's hand injury after its loss to Fremantle.

title.children: Magpies hopeful McStay's knee injury is 'minor'

image.altText: A farmer looks to the sky with machinery in the background.

props.synopsis: Anzac Day marks the traditional start for planting winter crops, but this year farmers are hoping for rain as they begin planting their crops in the dry.

title.children: Aussie farmers' grain gamble as rain fails to arrive before Anzac Day

image.altText: A sign saying Women's and Children's Hospital and public car park

props.synopsis: The personal data of more than 2,000 inpatients involved sleep studies at the Women's and Children's Hospital in Adelaide since 2018 has been accessed in a ransomware attack, with those affected being warned of identity theft risks.

title.children: Data of more than 2,000 SA patients hacked in ransomware attack

image.altText: A son and father stand next to each other and smile.

props.synopsis: As 94-year-old Australian war veteran Patrick Forbes prepares for his final Anzac Day march, he reflects back on his family's history of service which saw three members awarded the distinguished Military Cross.

title.children: Final Anzac Day march for veteran from three-time Military Cross family

image.altText: Former South Australian Liberal leader David Speirs walks away.

props.synopsis: Less than nine months ago, David Speirs held one of South Australia's most prominent and important jobs: the state's alternative premier and leader of the Liberal Party. Now, those titles have been replaced by "convicted drug supplier".

title.children: David Speirs has gone from alternative SA premier to convicted drug supplier

image.altText: A man with a blonde beard wearing a blue stripy polo shirt and a baseball cap

props.synopsis: WARNING: This story contains details that readers may find distressing. The family of a baby who died 42 hours after being "violently shaken" by his father has been left with "silence, grief and an emptiness that will never fully go away", a court has heard.

title.children: Family tells court of ongoing pain over death of 'innocent, defenceless' baby

image.altText: Hands holding a piece of ore, which has a metallic shine to it.

props.synopsis: A partnership between a Broken Hill family and a mining company is attempting to re-inject life into an old mine where drilling samples have revealed promising signs for the future.

title.children: High-grade silver, lead and zinc found at 140yo mine in outback NSW

image.altText: A woman sits with a typewriter on a brown wooden table.

props.synopsis: Pam Ashman has sat courtside for thousands of netball games, keeping score by hand and recording fixtures on her typewriter. Despite the painstaking work, the 78-year-old volunteer vows to "never ever" use a computer.

title.children: Trusty typewriter and a dedicated volunteer keeps netball league on track

image.altText: A concept image of two workers in high-vis walking past a row of large batteries.

props.synopsis: A large battery project in South Australia sells for nearly $500 million as investment in renewable energy surges.

title.children: Millions invested in big batteries amid net zero transition

image.altText: A man with pointy hair and maroon t-shirt smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: A man accused of the shooting murder of South Australian police officer Jason Doig has been found mentally incompetent by the state's Supreme Court.

title.children: Man charged over SA police officer's death found mentally incompetent

image.altText: A woman sitting down next to dogs.

props.synopsis: A group of Australian pet owners who say their dogs suffered adverse effects or died after receiving an osteoarthritis treatment are working to launch a class action, after a lawsuit was filed in the United States.

title.children: Pet owners consider class action over osteoarthritis drug

image.altText: Gloved hands holding COVID-19 vaccine, needle in glass container.

props.synopsis: Three local councils in South Australia have been passing motions questioning vaccines, but health experts say they are based on misinformation and heighten community risk.

title.children: Councils under fire for promoting vaccine scepticism

image.altText: The landscape of White Cliffs from the air

props.synopsis: Before the remote town of White Cliffs got state-funded transport to Broken Hill 300 kilometres away, some locals went long stretches without essential services and supplies.

title.children: Outback bus service 'essential' to far-flung opal mining town

image.altText: woman with white blonde hair and wearing a navy suit looks down the camera

props.synopsis: The body of the 41-year-old was found on Friday night at her property in Neergabby, about 80 kilometres north of Perth, her family announced "with utterly broken hearts" in a statement.

title.children: Virginia Giuffre, who alleged Jeffrey Epstein trafficked her to Prince Andrew, dies

image.altText: Virginia Roberts Giuffre

props.synopsis: She exposed the elite and broke her silence — now she's gone, but her story refuses to die.

title.children: Staring down the elite, Virginia Giuffre refused to be silenced

image.altText: A woman with brown hair sat behind a desk

props.synopsis: The US Marshals Service confirmed Hannah Dugan, a Milwaukee County circuit judge, was arrested at the courthouse where she works.

title.children: FBI arrests judge over allegations she obstructed immigration arrest

image.altText: Giants AFL players look dejected after walking from the field.

props.synopsis: The Western Bulldogs steamroll GWS by 32 points to notch their first back-to-back wins of the season, while Port Adelaide and the Brisbane Lions also taste victory.

title.children: Dejected Giants 'got some things to work out' after falling to Bulldogs

image.altText: Nathan Cleary look towards the big screen during an NRL match

props.synopsis: The Penrith Panthers, winners of the past four NRL competitions, will end the round eight bottom of the ladder after losing to Manly at Western Sydney Stadium.

title.children: 'Disappointing' Panthers fall to bottom of the NRL with another loss

image.altText: Birds eye view of a group of men with shaved heads sitting closely together

props.synopsis: At CECOT in El Salvador there are no family visits, no access to the outdoors, no rehabilitation programs.

title.children: Inside the mega-prison where the only way out 'is in a coffin'

image.altText: A chart shows the breakdown of energy generation over the course of a day, including coal, gas and renewables

props.synopsis: Our energy system is evolving at breakneck speed. Here we look at how our power grid works, what more renewables mean for energy prices, how nuclear fits into the picture, and how we might build a grid fit for the future.

title.children: What might our future power grid look like? This illustrated guide explains

image.altText: Decklen Deaves-Thornton, 22, has been charged with murder

props.synopsis: Decklen Deaves-Thornton is accused of the shooting murder of 18-year-old Ekampreet Sahni Singh in a car park at Bar Beach on Wednesday.

title.children: Man accused of teen's murder 'remorseful' as hundreds attend vigil

image.altText: a close up of Pope Francis's hand, wearing a silver oval-like ring with a cross etched into it

props.synopsis: Despite Pope Francis opting for a simpler, humbler papacy compared to his predecessors, his death is not without ceremony. Let's unpack some of the symbols and rituals that come with farewelling the leader of the Catholic Church.

title.children: The deep symbolism and rituals surrounding the death of a pope

image.altText: A man looking at a cassowary walking by.

props.synopsis: A devastating cyclone helped Kenn Parker build his rainforest home, and now his favourite neighbours are the cassowaries who come to visit with their chicks.

title.children: The house that Yasi built: One man's solitary life with the cassowaries

image.altText: A woman swings a golf club during a round

props.synopsis: A sublime front nine has propelled Minjee Lee into contention at the halfway point of the biggest women's golf event of the year thus far.

title.children: Lee surges at Chevron Championship with brilliant second round

image.altText: Wests Tigers coach Benji Marshall pulls a face as he walks away from a press conference at training.

props.synopsis: Tigers coach Benji Marshall says he does not care if people question his decision to recall departing five-eighth Lachlan Galvin to the Wests Tigers first grade side after just one match in reserve grade.

title.children: Marshall 'sick of talking' about Galvin saga on eve of NRL recall

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman with short black hair, graying at the roots wearing a pink polo shirt sitting in front of her home.

props.synopsis: When Prime Minister Anthony Albanese visited the NT community to announce $4 billion to improve remote housing, the community were hopeful. But a year later, no new homes have been built.

title.children: Not one new home in Binjari where Albanese made $4b housing promise

image.altText: Headshot of Aunty Joy wearing classes and a possum fur coat.

props.synopsis: Wurundjeri elder Aunty Joy Murphy Wandin was due to walk out onto the field at the Storm vs Rabbitohs match alongside Aboriginal women from the Djirri Djirri dance group.

title.children: Elder heartbroken over 'hurtful' cancelling of NRL Welcome to Country

image.altText: A hand holds a lit cigarette

props.synopsis: With a packet of tobacco costing more than $100, smokers in Tjuntjuntjarra are in a vicious cycle, but have "little support" when it comes to quitting.

title.children: Almost everyone smokes in this community and locals want that to change

image.altText: A man in black is at the bottom centre of the image with two flags looming behind him

props.synopsis: It has been 11 years since Russia took control of the Crimean Peninsula. Here is what we know about what to expect next.

title.children: Russia has spent centuries fighting for Crimea, but Zelenskyy wants it too

image.altText: a solo climber on Mount Everest during a storm

props.synopsis: As Nepal moves to reform safety on Mt Everest, some of the peak's most respected guides question whether the new rules will save lives.

title.children: 'Buyer beware' on Mt Everest as guides question new rules

image.altText: A young mum, smiling at the camera while holding her baby.

props.synopsis: Researchers say women are feeling under represented in politics and struggle to speak up about the issues that matter to them.

title.children: As voter priorities shift, some women feel ignored by male politicians
